metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10539 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in WavPack 5.1.0 and earlier for DSDiff input.Out-of-bounds writes can occur because ParseDsdiffHeaderConfig in dsdiff.cdoes not validate the sizes of unknown chunks before attempting memoryallocation, related to a lack of integer-overflow protection within abytes_to_copy calculation and subsequent malloc call, leading toinsufficient memory allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwavpack1 - 5.1.0-2ubuntu1.1
wavpack - 5.1.0-2ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wavpack package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.0-2ubuntu1.1').
